page.title: 03Farming
page.content: This very rural area is composed of grazing & arable land with large areas of hardwood & coniferous woodland. Until the recent sale of the Hever Estate the woods were used mainly for pheasant rearing for sport. Now the farms are in private hands more wood is cut for land clearance & cash crops. Due to EEC regulations there are fewer dairy farms so less good hay & corn for home consumption are grown. More sheep, pigs & beef are raised. Seed corn, rape, potatoes & peas are grown. Changed nature of beer manufacture means less hops are needed leading to conversion of oasts & barns to homes for affluent commuters. A thriving vinery produces good white wine. All farms have good road connections. Several farmers wives provide bed & breakfast for tourists.
